TopicTitle: No f13. help please to access new debug.

Articles.Content: The new debug menu looks useful and fun. Me and apparently Google and Apple don't no how to access f13 and above fxx keys on the small iMac wireless keyboard?  Help from anyone a with greater sum of knowledge of those above would be appreciated.

F13 ain't a key... where do you need it for?

Btw: you toggle the debug/cheat menu with alt+F12
The only time I've ever heard of an F13 key was in some mock computer horror story in the 90's

Having more than 12 F-keys isn't common anymore. Maybe it never was.

But old keyboards with 24 F-keys were a thing.

3 hours ago, DrLicor said:

F13 ain't a key... where do you need it for?

Btw: you toggle the debug/cheat menu with alt+F12 

 

Thanks for not rubbing in my stupidity. Don't know what I was thinking face palm. Well I do now with my settings I need to press fn+option(alt)+F12.

Val yes I know I'm an old stand-up guy. 

Just now, bonyetty said:

Thanks for not rubbing in my stupidity. Don't know what I was thinking face palm. Well I do now with my settings I need to press fn+option(alt)+F12.

Val yes I know I'm an old stand-up guy. 

Btw I was being accurate my parents were not married when I was born.

2 hours ago, Val said:

Having more than 12 F-keys isn't common anymore. Maybe it never was.

But old keyboards with 24 F-keys were a thing.

Wow I don't think I've seen a keyboard like that in 15 years. And I've not seen one so uncovered in grime in ... well ever, probably. You can read every single letter on the home row.

(scurries off to find a recording of a buckling-spring keyboard... ah, memories)
I'd like to think pressing F14 would take you straight to the Danger Zone.

I think a good idea for any Mac player of video games might be reversing the fn-f-keys.

Go to System Preferences - Keyboard and check "Use all F1, F2 etc. keys as standard function keys". This way, the system functions such as volume or brightness adjustment are done with fn+Fx and you don't need to press fn when using function keys in KSP or other programs.

BTW next to your post I replied to is an upwards facing arrow. You can press this arrow next to any answer to mark this thread's question as answered so that it is easier for people to sort out answered and unanswered questions  (only moderators and the user who asked a specific question can mark it as answered, and moderators rarely do it as someone might have more questions to post in the same thread)
